intro: Codazzia nervosa, commonly known as the narrow-veined codazzia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with prominent veins and small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
